com.here.mobility.sdk.core.net

Class NetworkClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.mobility.sdk.core.net.NetworkClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DemandClient, GeocodingClient, RoutingClient

    public abstract class NetworkClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for wrappers of services provided over the network.

      • isNetworkConnected

        public boolean isNetworkConnected()
        Checks if there is a network connection
        Returns:
        true if there is any network connection available

      • directExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor directExecutor()
        Returns an Executor that simply runs its command in the calling thread. This can be used to get response listeners to get called directly on the I/O thread (which is dangerous, but avoids an extra thread).

      • newHandlerExecutor

        public static java.util.concurrent.Executor newHandlerExecutor(@NonNull
                                                               android.os.Handler handler)
        Returns an Executor that posts the command on the given Handler.

      • cancelAllActiveRequests

        public void cancelAllActiveRequests()
        Cancels all active requests this client has running. Note that this doesn't necessarily stop any underlying sending of data through the network. The only guarantee is that no response listeners will be called. Implementation note: unfortunately, GRPC stream requests provide no way to cancel them, so these are not currently cancelled.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down this NetworkClient. All active requests are cancelled, and the underlying channel is shutdown cleanly (requests in progress will finish, but no new ones will be accepted). Note that any streaming requests may continue indefinitely.

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Shuts down this NetworkClient immediately, forcefully closing even preexisting calls. This is the preferred method to call when using NetworkClient from an Android activity or service that is finishing, because it should guarantee that no further callbacks will be invoked.

      • onStatusConnectivityChanged

        public void onStatusConnectivityChanged(boolean hasNetworkConnection)
        this is being called by the ConnectivityReceiver whenever the network connection status is being changed it is being called only if the status was changed from 'has connection' to 'no connection' or vice versa.
        Parameters:
        hasNetworkConnection - true if has network connection
